title: Are there still Muslim descendants of Moors in Spain? - Quora

response.answer_text: Of course, there are people who have ancestry that comes from both the Jews and Moors/Arabs who lived there. That’s a minority of the ancestry in Spain. Some last names come from the Jews like Perez, Toledano, Laredo. For names that connect to Muslims I would say: Alvarez, Almodovar, Alvarado. When you’re talking about descendants, we’re talking about people who don’t follow Islam or Judaism and mixed in with the rest of the population and became Catholics and married other Catholics in Spain.

Maybe among the Moroccan immigrants who now live in Spain, you might find some of Moriscos descent. But I don’t think you have Muslim Spaniards who continuously lived in Spain since the Inquisition time while retaining their Islamic faith. I think all the Muslims who stayed in Spain eventually became Christians.

Not muslim descendants from moors, but genetical descendants from moors that embraced christianity at some point (however honesty)? There are tons of them. BTW, remember that “moor” wasn´t a racial term but a cultural one.
